title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 137.1 - Partnership income and deductions of nonresident partner derived from New York State sources
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 137.1 - Partnership income and deductions of nonresident partner derived from New York State sources

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 637(a)

The New York source income of a nonresident partner
includes the partner's distributive share of all items of partnership income, gain, loss and deduction entering into such partner's Federal adjusted gross
income to the extent such items are derived from or connected with New York

State sources, i.e., attributable to the ownership by the
partnership of any interest in real or tangible personal property in New York

State or to a business, trade, profession or occupation carried on in New York

State by the partnership as determined under sections
132.3, 132.4
(a), 132.6, 132.9, 132.12
-132.16, 132.21 and 132.22 of this article and 137.2 of this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
137.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
